[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Event Planning System (EPS) enables event organizers to plan, manage, and track events, including scheduling, budgeting, vendor coordination, guest management, and ticketing.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: EPS supports event creation, scheduling, budgeting, venue booking, vendor management, guest invitations, ticket sales, and real-time tracking.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: EPS integrates with venue booking, payment gateways, messaging, and ticketing systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: EPS provides a web and mobile UI for event planners, vendors, and attendees.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: EPS supports desktops, tablets, and smartphones.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: EPS uses REST APIs, secure authentication, and cloud storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: EPS provides email alerts and messaging.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: EPS optimizes storage for event records, guest lists, and finances.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: EPS manages events, schedules, and guests.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: EPS customizes workflows and templates per event type.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: EPS integrates with social media and finance tools.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: EPS facilitates event planning, budgeting, ticketing, vendor coordination, and attendee engagement.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: EPS serves event planners, vendors, sponsors, and attendees.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: EPS requires internet access for real-time updates and collaboration.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: EPS relies on payment gateways, venue databases, and messaging services.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall allow event organizers to create and manage events, including scheduling and budgeting.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall support vendor bidding and contract tracking.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall integrate with payment gateways for ticket sales and vendor payments.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to create events, set dates, manage venues, and allocate budgets (REQ-INTF-001, REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall support guest management, including invitations, RSVPs, seating arrangements, and ticketing (REQ-INTF-002, REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall track event progress and send key notifications.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall provide expense reports, attendee analytics, and vendor evaluations.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive UI for event creation, vendor selection, and guest management.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process event updates and sync data within 2 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store event details, guest lists, vendor contracts, ticket sales, and financial transactions.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall support encryption for secure data handling.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with event management, financial reporting, and data privacy regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure secure authentication and encrypted storage.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests validate event scheduling, vendor management, budgeting, guest tracking, and ticketing.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, and compliance guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: Event management standards, financial reporting guidelines, and data privacy policies.
